revised_title: Polymorphism of Trypanosoma gambiense and its Relation to the Exogenous Cycle in Glossina palpalis
tldr: The author investigates the polymorphism of Trypanosoma gambiense in the blood and its relation to the exogenous cycle in Glossina palpalis. The study reveals that a certain type of trypanosome is responsible for carrying on the cycle in the transmitting host, and provides insights into the factors controlling the numbers of parasites present in the blood.
